Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 33331: Commercial and Service Industry Machinery Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: Atlantic States Cast Iron Pipe Co.
Description: Atlantic States Cast Iron Pipe Co. a Phillipsburg, N.J.-based division of McWane Inc. of Alabama was sentenced to pay a fine of $8 million for violations of environmental and worker safety laws as well as obstructing the federal investigation of its conduct. A federal judge also sentenced the company to serve four years of probation, during which it will be subject to oversight by a court-appointed monitor who would report twice annually to the court.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/cast-iron-pipe-manufacturer-sentenced-environmental-crimes-and-worker-safety-violations

Company: Clow Water Systems Company A Division of McWane, Inc.
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: McWane Inc., a national cast iron pipe manufacturer headquartered in Birmingham, Ala., agreed to resolve more than 400 violations of federal and state environmental law at 28 of its manufacturing facilities in 14 states as part of a settlement filed in federal court and announced by the Justice Department, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, and the states of Alabama and Iowa.
Info Source: http://www2.epa.gov/enforcement/mcwane-inc-settlement

Description: In a case involving criminal violations of the Clean Water Act, McWane was sentenced to pay a fine of $5 million, serve a period of probation for five years and ordered to perform a community service project valued at $2.7 million.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2005/December/05_enrd_643%20%20%20.html

Description: Cast-iron pipe manufacturer McWane, Inc. pleaded guilty to environmental crimes in connection with the operation of Pacific States Cast Iron Pipe Company. Specifically, McWane pleaded guilty to two counts of submitting a document to the State of Utah containing falsified emission test results. McWane was ordered to pay a $3 million fine and to serve a three-year period of probation.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2006/February/06_enrd_065.html

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 332996: Fabricated Pipe and Pipe Fitting Manufacturing
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Tyler Pipe Company, a division of McWane, Inc., agreed to plead guilty to two Clean Air Act felony counts, pay a criminal fine of $4.5 million, and undertake extensive upgrades at its iron foundry facility located near the City of Tyler in Smith County, Texas, arising from its illegal construction and operation of the facility's south plant cupola.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2005/March/05_enrd_138.htm

Description: Union Foundry Company, a division of McWane, Inc., was sentenced to $4.25 million in criminal fines and community service after pleading guilty to a two-count information resulting from the investigation of worker safety and environmental violations at the Union Foundry facility in Anniston, Alabama.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2005/September/05_enrd_458.html

Description: Racial discrimination. The defendant filed an appeal but in February 2018 that appeal was placed in default for failure to pay a filing fee.
Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: RICKEY MOLAND vs. MCWANE INC ET AL
Info Source: BNA's Employment Discrimination Report, July 12, 2017

Description: McWane agreed to pay $332,000 to Alabama and $92,802 to Iowa as part of a $13.1 million settlement with the federal government over more than 400 environmental violations. For details of the larger settlement, see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-mcwane-inc
